Nouse interviews nightclub photographer, Felix Wahlberg

By James Clay

Nouse sits down with nightclub photographer and University of York student Felix Wahlberg.

YUSU celebrates and recognises the voluntary work of students across York

By James Clay

Student volunteers acknowledged during Student Volunteering Week 2023

Local Plan for York under consideration

By James Clay

Plans for future investment in housing and infrastructure are being debated by the local council

UCU strikes stood down

By Gracie Daw

Action on 21, 22, 23, 27, 28 February and 1 and 2 March will not go ahead

YUSU Election Results 2023

By James Clay

Pierrick Roger re-elected as YUSU President

YUSU Election Results 2023

By James Clay

Pierrick Roger re-elected as YUSU President

Tokyo photographer criticised for degrading images

York nightclub Tokyo has faced accusations of misconduct after a freelance photographer hired by the club asked girls to kiss each other for photographs he was taking (Thumbnail credit Photo: Tokyo/Facebook)

University Lecturer receives award

David Hickman, a senior lecturer in the Department of Theatre, Film and Television, has won a prestigious Grierson award for his Channel 4 film <em>Race and Intelligence: Science's Last Taboo</em>

Library construction continues

The handover of the library's second floor was delayed this term and further work may be needed on it over Christmas as refurbishment continues

Gathering of international scholars

A host of international academics gathered at the University last week to discuss the central issues in the role of education in the recovery and development of crisis-torn societies

Break-in confirmed at University library

Police were called to the University of York Library in the early hours of this morning, after reports of an attempted break-in (Thumbnail credit The break-in caused permanant damage to the University library doors. Photo credit: Peter Iverson)

Students take part in Millbank Centre riots

Yesterday's largely peaceful NUS protest has been overshadowed by the events at the Tory headquarters at 30 Millbank (Thumbnail credit Photo: Sam Newsome)

Protest in pictures

Photos from the national student demolition against higher tuition fees in London, 10 November 2010 (Thumbnail credit Photo: Sam Newsome)

Success of fee rise protest marred by violent minority

Tens of thousands of students swarmed the streets of central London on Wednesday, in protest against the planned tripling of tuition fees (Thumbnail credit York students march with an estimated 52,000 through Whitehall. Photo: Sam Newsome)

Live Coverage from the Student Demolition

Today over 24,000 students have packed out the streets of London to protest against the rise in student fees. Hundreds of students from the University of York are also in attendance to fight for the financial freedom of future students

Ron Weir Memorial Garden unveiled

Derwent Day 2010, which took place yesterday in the heart of the college, saw the gathering of past and present 'Derwentians' to celebrate the inauguration of the Ron Weir Memorial Garden and the celebration of 45 years of Derwent (Thumbnail credit All photos: Lucy Dixon)

Societies express anger over UGM motion

A motion put forward at yesterday's Union General Meeting (UGM), proposing changes to the societies grant allocation process, caused controversy among many students in attendance

Fees of up to PS9,000 for new students

New students could face fees of up to PS9,000 in order to attend university from 2012, the government announced yesterday (Thumbnail credit Universities Minister David Willetts announced institutions will be allowed to charge students up to PS9,000 for their university education. Image: conservativeparty via Flickr Creative Commons)

Fusion promotion video released

Fusion, the dance, modelling and entertainment society, has announced the dates of the auditions for its cast, in a promotional video released today

Big Bang branded 'Big Con'

YUSU have been strongly criticised by a number of University of York students after only 900 of approximately 2300 scanned ticket holders gained entry to see headline act Marina and the Diamonds at the fresher's week event "The Big Bang"

Langwith Bar Reps condemned by students for 'horrific' rape question in Freshers' week bar quiz

A number of students have expressed their concern over the inclusion of a "callous and insensitive" question in this week's Langwith College bar quiz (Thumbnail credit Questions at the Langwith Bar quiz, held in The Courtyard, caused much upset among students in attendance. Photo credit: Justyn Hardcastle)

Gallery claim YUSU 'personally victimised' them

Controversy arose this week after the manager of The Gallery nightclub claimed he had been "personally victimised by the York Student Union", after an ongoing deal between the two parties was severed earlier this year (Thumbnail credit Gallery management have accused YUSU of reneging on their agreement. Photo credit: Lucy Dixon)

The Nouse Student Survey 2010

By James Bithell

Liv Evans and Sam Lawson present the results of the <em>Nouse</em> Student Survey 2010, a comprehensive review of student opinion and experience at the University of York

English Department opens new space

The English Departement has opened a new space for students. The F.R. Leavis room will be used for "out of hour study and group discussion"

Death of University Professor

A former University of York Professor, Kay Jones, died on 13 October 2010. Professor Jones was the founding Head of the Department of Social Policy and Social Work and spent 22 years in charge of the Department

Nobel Prize laureate to lecture at York

Professor Harold Koto, who was awarded a Nobel Prize for Chemistry in 1996, and was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society, is to give a lecture today in the Physics department

Mass student protests over Browne Review proposals

As students nationwide are rallying against the funding cuts and fee rises to higher education institutions, <em>Nouse</em> investigates the reaction on campus (Thumbnail credit The demonstration finished in Parliament St where YUSU President, Tim Ngwena gave a speech to the crowd. Photo credit: Sam Newsome)

LGBT email mix-up 'outs' its members

YUSU's LGBT Social has been strongly criticised after accidentally 'outing' 100s of University of York students

Commercial Services' events fail

Considerably low attendance and a lack of organisation at a series of events run last week by Commercial Services saw many of the acts 'booked' for each night pulling out (Thumbnail credit Despite plenty of advertising, the week failed to attract students)

Council review YUM chair

Union council has voted to reassess the role of York University Media (YUM) Chair in Union Council in the next constitutional review. If this passes, YUM Chair will be removed from its seat on Council

Stolen bicycles returned by police

The successes of a recent police investigation, Operation Maelstrom, have helped to assuage student fears about bicycle thefts in York (Thumbnail credit Police initiatives to decrease student bike thefts have been a success. Photo credit: Peter Iveson)

New Barbican arena renovation commences

Renovation on the Barbican centre, an arts and entertainment centre in a close proximity to the University campus, is due to start this month (Thumbnail credit SMG Europe Limited, which owns Leeds Arena and Metro Radio Arena in Newcastle, now own the Barbican. Photo credit: Sam Newsome)

Protest for fire station move

Fears for student safety have been raised after plans were announced to relocate the Clifford's Street Fire Station out of the City Centre to Huntingdon (Thumbnail credit The Clifford Street Fire Station which is closing and being relocated. Photo credit: Lucy Dixon)

'SinneD' event raises PS6,700 for charity

The Big D committee have announced that this year's event, 'SinneD', raised almost PS7,000 for charity (Thumbnail credit Big D contained seven different areas which decorated campus to represent the seven deadly sins. Photo credit: George Lowther)

Nouse Student Survey 2010

The Nouse Student Survey - a comprehensive review of the student experience and differing opinions on student issues

University profit from housing deficit

Outrage has been expressed by many of this year's incoming freshers, after learning that the University looks set to profit from the undergraduate accommodation shortage (Thumbnail credit Justyn Hardcastle)

York nightclub Tokyo has faced accusations of misconduct after a freelance photographer hired by the club asked girls to kiss each other for photographs he was taking (Thumbnail credit Photo: Tokyo/Facebook)
